tweets.text:
RT @cb_doge: Elon Musk on Starship:

"If there are historians in the future, they will look back at Starship and say it was one of the most‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
Elon Musk on Starship:

"If there are historians in the future, they will look back at Starship and say it was one of the most profound things that ever happened. The degree to which a Starship is a revolutionary technology is not well understood in the world.

It's the first time that there's been any rocket design where full and rapid reusability is possible. This is the first design where success is in the set of possible outcomes. There were a lot of performance improvements for v3 so it made sense to go to v3, there's like 10,000 different changes between v2 and v3. 

There just aren't very many things that are in the top 10 of the evolution of life. So if there were to be a catastrophe on one of the planets, the other planet would survive and no AI was used to create it."

tweets.text: RT @anammostarac: The only reason we know about this case is that the judge decided to lift reporting restrictions on naming the rapists, f‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
The only reason we know about this case is that the judge decided to lift reporting restrictions on naming the rapists, following applications by media organisations.

The unfortunate truth is that this trend is almost certainly worse than reported, as sealed cases, victim intimidation, and lenient sentencing have skewed public perception into thinking these horrific incidents are mere aberrations. These state-sponsored PR campaigns to suppress the truth have done nothing but curb accountability and deepen public distrust.

tweets.text:
RT @jeffreyweichsel: Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics

1.  A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics

1.  A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
2. A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law.
3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.

Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics were meant to ensure robots prioritize human safety, obedience, and self-preservation. However, his stories largely revolved around how these laws failed in practice, leading to paradoxes, loopholes, and unintended consequences in complex scenarios.

Applying these laws to AGI seems even more flawed, as AGI would possess human-level or superior adaptability, potentially rewriting or evading any imposed constraints. Since AGI is defined by its uncontrollability, fostering intrinsic honesty‚Äîwhere the system voluntarily aligns with human values and discloses its reasoning‚Äîoffers a more realistic path to coexistence, avoiding the pitfalls Asimov illustrated. 

@Grok feels like the best avenue for humanity to benefit from AGI.

tweets.text:
RT @EricLDaugh: üö® LMFAO! Elon Musk gives the most ELON answer to "what would you do if you started over with $1,000?"

"It's somewhat of an‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
üö® LMFAO! Elon Musk gives the most ELON answer to "what would you do if you started over with $1,000?"

"It's somewhat of an impossible dichotomy, because civilization would have had to have been destroyed or something, in which case $1,000 is not going to solve your problems."

"And if civilization hasn't melted, then I could probably just tell people to give me money, which I've done before." ü§£üî• @elonmusk 

"A lot of things would have to go wrong for that to be the case. It's like, am I just emerging from prison, perhaps, with a stipend? All my companies have been confiscated."

"I mean, it would take armageddon, which hopefully that doesn't happen, like Ragnarok next level, and I lost."

"I mean, it's impossible for someone to have this amount of knowledge, all the knowledge that I have, and then be dropped down to a low resource amount."

"Because the reality is that either something truly catastrophic has happened, like civilization has melted, or I will be able to ask people to just give me money, and with the promise that I will have a high return, which is what I'm able to do right now. Like if you give me a dollar, you will get back much more than a dollar."
